subject: Education
title: Dual Coding: Words Plus Pictures
description: A micro-lesson that makes Dual Coding: Words Plus Pictures usable.

hook.text: Which do you remember better: a word list or a comic strip?

buildup.text: Allan Paivio proposed that the brain stores verbal and visual info separately.

discovery.text: When you encode something both ways, you create two retrieval paths, not one.

twist.text: Bad visuals that don't match the text actually hurt learningâ€”noise, not signal.

climax.text: Effective dual coding means the image and the words reinforce the same idea.

punchline.text: Two paths to the same memory doubles your odds.

quiz.question: Why does dual coding improve memory?
options: It creates two separate retrieval paths for the same information
Pictures are always easier than words
It reduces the need for attention
